page.title: 05Royal Victoria Country Park
page.content: Probably the greatest change in the area in recent years was the demolishion of the{Royal Victoria {Hospital}in 1979.Until then the hospital,completed in 1863,had dominated the landscape for 113yrs. It was 468yds long and had a huge chapel at the centre which is topped with a green copper dome.The building was of the Italien style favoured by the Victorians and is repeated at {Osborne House}on the Isle of Wight. The{chapel}still stands as a{ {monument}to a bygone era and has been renovated for public use. The Officers Mess may be turned into flats but it has now become dangerous because of vandalism and has been fenced off.Some of the buildings are still used by the Hampshire Police, the park Warden and for sports use. .
